intro: Rosa platyacantha var. leucacantha, commonly known as the white-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a variant of the shrub rose characterized by its distinctive white stems and pale pink to white flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is known for its compact growth habit and winter hardiness. The plant produces small, fragrant blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are dark green, oval-shaped, and arranged alternately along the stems. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in cooler climates.
